node.title: Reddit's Wildest 2021 Posts—From Being Inside a Whale to Surviving a Heist
node.description: The site shared a look into some of its most popular posts of the year, including some out-there tales from Reddit users.

node.title: U.S. and Israel discuss "alternatives" should Iran nuclear talks fail
node.description: As Iran resumes negotiations to revive the crumbling nuclear deal, the U.S. is running out of patience, and considering "alternatives we may be forced to pursue."

node.title: ‘The Lady of Heaven’ Review: A Tale of Two Eras
node.description: This historical epic about the life of Fatima, the daughter of the Prophet Muhammad, is a mechanical history lesson riddled with clichés.

node.title: A Tenor’s Met Career Seemed Over. Not So Fast.
node.description: Rolando Villazón, a onetime star plagued by vocal issues, is returning to the house after eight years for “The Magic Flute.”

node.title: Oxford District, Officials Facing $100M Lawsuits From Parents of 2 Students, 1 Injured in Shooting
node.description: The filings allege that school officials failed to prevent a deadly attack that exacted physical and psychological wounds on students.

node.title: Man behind viral "Byron" videos gets help from strangers
node.description: Many know him as "Byron" or just "that guy from Coney Island." He went viral on TikTok for his innocent and impromptu interview on the street.

node.title: Ken Jennings and Mayim Bialik to Share ‘Jeopardy!’ Hosting Duties
node.description: The long-running quiz show decided to keep the hosts into its 38th season in 2022, putting an end, at least for now, to speculation and drama around the job.

node.title: Face Computers Are Coming. Now What?
node.description: Instead of letting Facebook or Apple decide the norms of this new technology, we need to do it.

node.title: Archeologists 'Stunned' After Discovering Evidence of Crucified Person
node.description: The skeleton was uncovered at a Roman settlement in eastern England. It is the first discovery of its kind in the U.K. and only the fourth in the world.

node.title: Travis Scott Says He Believes He Did Everything He Could During Astroworld Tragedy
node.description: In his first interview since the fatal concert in Houston, Scott says that standing on stage he believed "a thousand percent" he did everything possible.

node.title: New eye drops could replace reading glasses for millions
node.description: Vuity, which was approved by the Food and Drug Administration in October, would potentially replace reading glasses for some of the 128 million Americans who have trouble seeing close-up.

node.title: 13 Albums That Revisit (and Redefine!) Holiday Classics
node.description: Fresh seasonal releases from Kelly Clarkson, Bryson Tiller, Nat King Cole and Pistol Annies span genres and generations.

node.title: Dozens of Earthquakes Strike Off Oregon Coast, but Experts Say Not to Worry
node.description: At least 66 earthquakes rattled the Blanco Fracture Zone from Tuesday into Wednesday, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.

node.title: The Buffalo News publisher rejects a bid from Alden Global Capital.
node.description: The board of Lee Enterprises voted 8-0 against an unsolicited offer by the hedge fund that valued the newspaper chain at $141 million.

node.title: ‘The Little Prince’ to Land on Broadway With Dance and Acrobatics
node.description: This international production, an adaptation of the novella that is described as “a theatrical experience with musical elements,” will run for five months.

node.title: Why U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson Is in Hot Water Over a Christmas Party
node.description: The British prime minister has faced criticism following a leaked video showing his staff joking about a holiday party allegedly held at 10 Downing Street.

node.title: Texas Power Struggle: Greg Abbott, Beto O'Rourke Know Outages Could Be Key This Winter
node.description: Texas Governor Abbott has promised "the lights will stay on" this winter following major failures earlier this year.

node.title: How Donald Trump Could Become Speaker of the House Without Running for Office
node.description: Trump called the chatter about him becoming Speaker of the House in 2022 "very interesting."

node.title: Over 17,000 Christians Condemn Lauren Boebert's Islamophobic Remarks, Demand Censure
node.description: Faithful America said that Christians "need [to] show Congress that American Christians stand in solidarity with American Muslims."

node.title: Drew Barrymore on being sober for 2.5 years
node.description: Drew Barrymore told "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King that said she has not had a drink in over two years

node.title: Daunte Wright's mom says she saw son's lifeless body in car after shooting
node.description: She also testified that she could tell her son's body was under a sheet near his car because she recognized his tennis shoes.

node.title: Lina Wertmüller, Italian Director of Provocative Films, Dies at 93
node.description: She established a idiosyncratic reputation for blending tragedy and farce, politics and sex. She was the first woman to be nominated for a best director Oscar.

node.title: Birds Aren’t Real, or Are They? Inside a Gen Z Conspiracy Theory.
node.description: Peter McIndoe, the 23-year-old creator of the viral Birds Aren’t Real movement, is ready to reveal what the effort is really about.

node.title: Capitol Hill staffer arrested for carrying gun into House office building
node.description: The staffer told officers he forgot the gun was in his bag, according to U.S. Capitol Police.

node.title: DOJ urges Supreme Court to reject Harvard affirmative action case
node.description: The Supreme Court asked the Justice Department in June to weigh in on the case.

node.title: Elderly Dog Abandoned at Airport As Owner Jets to Miami Finds New Home
node.description: Bama's previous owner dropped his leash and walked away upon discovering she didn't have the right paperwork to take the dog with her, police said.

node.title: Jobless claims fall to 52-year low as layoffs decline
node.description: Only 184,000 Americans filed for unemployment benefits last week, the lowest number since 1969.

node.title: Conversion therapy banned in Canada
node.description: Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau called conversion therapy "despicable and degrading."

node.title: ‘Back to the Outback’ Review: Pest in Show
node.description: A group of reptile house critters escape from an Australian zoo in this endearing animated adventure.

node.title: The T List: Holiday Gift Guide, Part II
node.description: Beauty stocking stuffers, cashmere slippers, homemade pasta — and more.
